content: Hello Ms. Lady Liberty! If you're looking for a place to stay in New York City, I would highly recommend the Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Times Square. It's a pet-friendly, extended stay hotel with modern amenities such as free Wi-Fi, spacious suites with full kitchens, and separate lounge areas. You can start your day with their complimentary hot breakfast buffet, and enjoy drinks and dinner entrees at their restaurant, Bryant Park Lounge, in the evening. The hotel is in a prime location, making it easy to explore nearby iconic attractions like Times Square, the Broadway Theatre District, Empire State Building, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and Rockefeller Center. You might also be interested in visiting the Museum of Modern Art, the American Museum of Natural History, or Central Park.

If you're looking for a kid-friendly place in New York City, I would recommend the Children's Museum of Manhattan (CMOM) located at 212 W 83rd St. It's a fun and interactive museum designed specifically for kids between the ages of 0-10. They have a variety of exhibits that are hands-on and encourage children to play, learn, and explore. Some of the popular exhibits are PlayWorks, an interactive exhibit that helps develop early childhood skills and creativity, and Adventures with Dora and Diego, a bilingual exhibit that transports children to the rainforest and teaches them about animals, geography, and conservation. CMOM also offers programs and workshops throughout the year, such as art classes, dance performances, and science experiments, to keep kids engaged and entertained.

There are plenty of options to consider for things to do in New York City today. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Visit Times Square: Explore the vibrant atmosphere of Times Square, take photos with the iconic billboards, and soak in the energy of the city.

2. Catch a Broadway Show: Experience the magic of Broadway by watching a live performance. There are a variety of shows to choose from, ranging from musicals to plays.

3. Take a Stroll in Central Park: Enjoy the beauty of nature in the heart of the city. Take a leisurely walk through Central Park, rent a bike, or have a picnic on the grassy lawns.

4. Visit the Empire State Building: Take an elevator ride to the top of the famous Empire State Building and enjoy panoramic views of the city skyline. It's a great way to get a bird's eye view of New York City.

5. Explore Museums: New York City is home to many world-class museums. You can visit the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), the American Museum of Natural History, the Metropolitan Museum of Art (the Met), or the Guggenheim Museum, among others.

6. Take a Statue of Liberty Cruise: Take a ferry to Liberty Island and see the iconic Statue of Liberty up close. The cruise will also give you stunning views of the Manhattan skyline.

7. Enjoy Local Cuisine: Treat yourself to some famous New York cuisine. Indulge in a slice of pizza, try a classic pastrami sandwich, or have a bagel with cream cheese and lox.

These are just a few options, and there are many more attractions, activities, and events happening in New York City today. Choose something that suits your interests and have a wonderful time exploring the city!
